reviews.sentence: Very Nice Hotel and Truly Enjoyed My Stay. I came here for a convention last month and the hotel was convenient clean very nice room and bathroom was large with great lighting. The convention rooms across the street were very nice and the food was catered and was delicious and still warm. Many times banquets have cool or cold food. The last night I was there we attended an installation and the Chinese food they served was wonderful. I highly recommend this hotel and if you enjoy nature the grounds and golf courses were beautiful. A duck pond was right outside our convention room so I enjoyed watching the birds when the rain came. Many celebrities stay here and some of our friends even saw a past president guess who who had come for a big golf tournament.

Great Stay. Unfortunately we were only able to stay for one night. We would have liked to spend a few days at the resort. The staff at the hotel was very good. The room was impeccable. The hotel is located on two terrific golf courses that we have played in the past. The location next to the golf club and the Hyat allows guests to have a great variety of activities and restaurant choices all within a very short walk. A great place to stay.

Awesome Yime in the Desert. Beautiful resort well situated to handle our business seminar. Rooms are spacious staff is friendly pool was clean and refreshing and I won my ping pong match. Great place to stay if you have a family or golf outing too.
Nice rooms and great pool friendly service. We have a great view of the golf course it is very lovely.

Great hotel. I had a room facing the pool. It was a bit loud with the pool noise and courtyard noise at night and in the morning so if you are a light sleeper probably not great. The staff was very friendly. The room was clean and very comfortable. Cava restaurant has good food and I loved the lemon ricotta pancakes. I also went to the spa and it was nice. I did not go to the outdoor area because it was drizzly during my visit and a bit cold.

Paradise. This was our eight return trip to the Renaissance Indian Wells Resort and Spa and each time is like coming home. Beautiful grounds excellent friendly service comfortable quiet and spacious rooms. The view of the pool and gardens is to die for. Nothing could be better.

Lovely hotel. Great pool facilities with plenty of chairs. Great gym with a sauna and steam room. I believe all the rooms have balconies. Rooms have huge new TVs with netflix and free HBO Go. Service level is very high and the hotel staff has always gotten me what I need. Thanks for the great service Ozy.

Overall Well Done. Was here for a large conference. So I did not experience most of the amenities except the pool and golf. The rooms are pretty spacious with plenty of room for 2. The pool is nice and the golf is good for a resort facility. Having done a lot of conferences and having eaten a lot of bad chicken dishes I will say the food and service at this hotel was better than most. It is not easy to take care of a few hundred people a day. I would say they tried to put some thought into the meals rather than just making sure they had enough plates and do the bare minimum. Service throughout the hotel was friendly and efficient. My only complaint was that they did not seem to expect the pre dinner rush at the lobby bar on a couple of occasions. Tough to staff for a one hour onslaught I know. But you have to expect that there is going to be a rush pre dinner and 2 bartenders could not keep up.

Great Hotel for Kids Families. Another family and ours decided to do a quick weekend getaway from LA to the Palm Springs area for Presidents Day weekend. Found out about this hotel from Red Tricycle which has a nice article summarizing why this is a great place for families and the article was spot on. All the kids immediately noticed how impressive the pool area is. We only arrived in the late afternoon and did not have a chance to experience it ourselves until after dinner. However even though it was a cold night the main family pool with a small beach and graduated entry stayed warm. And the jacuzi was hot but not too hot so that was nice. We had dinner at the on site pizza restaurant. There was some confusion about corkage when I called down to the front desk they called the restaurant and then got back to me that there was no corkage so we happily brought down our own bottle only to be told that they do in fact charge a 25 corkage fee. When I explained that I had called and was told there was no corkage they kindly waived the fee. The service was a bit slow considering only one other table was being used when we arrived and the drink menu strangely did not include any wines nor did they bring us a wine menu after we asked. But the place is kid friendly and the pizzas were good. The rooms were nice with good showers and the hotel was able to provide our families with adjoining rooms which was great. Our rate also included breakfast for 4 for only 12 more per room so a great deal so we were able to enjoy a nice buffet that included lots of fresh fruit and an omelet bar. One other great feature of this hotel the gym. it is one of the largest hotel gyms I have ever seen. It includes the usual equipment treadmills bikes elipticals as well as some weight machines free weights rope tension equipment a screen where you can select video workouts and even 2 Peloton bikes. And they provide free earbuds as well. Very nice.

Indian Wells. The Residents Indian Wells Resort Spa in Palm Spring California was an awesome place for my family to travel for spring break. It was about two hours away from downtown Los Angeles and I would definitely recommend this hotel for families of all ages. It was an old hotel that was recently renovated and was a very nice hotel. It was located in a very nice part of town as you can definitely walk to nearby restaurants. The customer service was excellent along with its amenities. All of the workers were always so helpful and kind. It had an awesome pool area for all ages as there were always enough chairs and also had polside cabanas. The property was also very nice as there were tennis courts a basketball hoop golf and a mini beach. There are lots of places to hike with mountains everywhere. Also in the middle of the pool there was a bar that you could swim out to and enjoy a nice drink or some food. Inside the hotel there were three restaurants. One casual sports bar an italian and a sushi place. All three were great options to eat at as all were kid friendly had excellent service and had large menus. There was also a very large lawn outside towards the back part of the property. This was a great spot as we saw a wedding one night then a business conference the next. The rooms were nice and spacious and some also came with an outdoor patio. The scenery and the views were beautiful as you can see the sunset as well as giant mountains out in the distance. Overall this was an awesome hotel with lots of great activities for all ages. It also had awesome restaurants and beautiful views. So I would definitely recommend this hotel for a family of all ages.

Nice hotel but the resort fee is ridiculous. Then you have a little snack shop that closes at 5. They charge you a arm and leg for breakfast. The guys out front were fantastic. I wanted to find out about golf and nobody was there even called that and was told to leave a message. We will be back to the area just not this hotel.

Good convention hotel. The lobby staircase and pool are highlights of this hotel along with good restaurants and meeting facilities. The pool is very large and there ’s a sandy beach too. Plenty of umbrellas if you are trying to avoid sun. There does n’t appear to be much to do other than golf in walking distance from the hotel. So plan your trip accordingly and use transportation to take you to outside venues. We had our meeting in the Crystal ballrooms with food provided to our group in the Stir room.

Was here for a UFO conference Contact in the Desert. it is a very nice resort where I never felt crowded. Your choice of restaurants is limited but on the other hand I never had to wait. The concierge is hit or miss but hey if you want to golf they have got you covered. Very helpful staff always willing to take care of you. We had a nice room that was thankfully off the atrium where noise was at a minimum. We were there for four nights.

Has been our go to in Indian Wells for years. We have been going here with our kids for years. The property is beautiful very spread out. The pool is very cool with great bar and grill service polside. My wife has used the spa several times and has been very pleased. I ’ve stayed at the Hyat next door and can tell you this place blows it out of the water.

Unfortunately we were not notified of the construction taking place. There were services I was looking forward to that were unavailable for example the spa was closed. Also I paid the addition 20 night for breakfast buffet but that was also closed. The hotel did provide a credit for the breakfast however I would have appreciated a notification.

Beautiful views from brightly updated rooms. The room was bright and comfortable updated throughout. Unique wood shutters covering the sliding door to small balcony could be opened to spectacular views of the mountains and overlooking the golf course. Several outdoor conversation areas wrapped around large fire pits. Waterfalls and beach entry pool gave true resort feel. Cozy lounge roomy conference accommodations and good food made it easy to stay play and network.

Great hospitality. This is an amazing place to relax. The staff is very friendly. Rooms are big and clean. I believe it is a balcony with great views in every one. Perfect place for a family vacation with a lot of activities for every one. And if you play golf or and tennis do not look any further.

I gave it a 2 start rating only because i was bothered by the fact I booked 2 SPA massage treatments for my husband and I and when we got there they shorted my time and said it was only 50 minutes when online it said 60 minutes and even though i showed them proof. online Jackie still said she could not honor 60 minutes and not to mention she also said the price was higher then what it said online as well even though she did honor that but my husband and I were very angry after massage because they did not even end up respecting the time we were literally out within 35 minutes and next day we realized we were also over charged by about 65 dollars more on my bank act. I called and they said it was gratuity. So be careful because they pay themselves whatever they want without even advising or having you sign anything and they do not even provide receipt. Now its bothering and frustrating that you have to call to complaint in order to get a refund since they should have never done this to begin with.

Lobby bar restaurant will serve if you beg and go to the bar for service but not otherwise. Outdoor gathering areas are lovely but no service and indoors is as bright as a basketball gym with zero ambiance. Room remodel is lovely but housekeeping extremely poor. Went back to our room at 4 pm not clean called and they never came. They actually told us they have no timeline as to when it will be clean. Back at 9 pm still not cleaned. Out of towels and toiletries water etc. paid way too much for this substandard service.

This is a great hotel in the perfect location. Rooms were just all renovated and they look awesome. A quick Uber ride to lots of restaurants and amenities. Hotel has an awesome pool with tons of chairs and yummy drinks food. Lobby bar has a great ambiance and great outdoor fireplaces to relax for an evening drink snack. I do n’t golf but the course looks great.
